title: Six-Goal Thriller: Barcelona Rally Three Times to Secure 3-3 Draw at Club Brugge
description: Barcelona were forced to come from behind three times...
author: sham
content:
In a pulsating UEFA Champions League encounter at the Jan Breydel Stadium, Barcelona were held to a dramatic 3-3 draw by Club Brugge on November 6, 2025. The Spanish giants were forced to come from behind three times in a match that exposed their defensive vulnerabilities but also highlighted their attacking resilience.

Club Brugge stunned the visitors early, with Nicolo Tresoldi opening the scoring in the 6th minute. Ferran Torres responded swiftly for Barcelona just two minutes later, leveling the score at 1-1. However, Carlos Forbs proved to be a constant menace for the Catalan defense, restoring Brugge’s lead in the 17th minute and again in the 63rd, after Lamine Yamal had equalized in the 61st.

Barcelona’s final lifeline came in the 77th minute when Christos Tzolis forced an own goal, ensuring the match ended in a 3-3 stalemate. Despite dominating possession with 77%, Barcelona’s backline was repeatedly breached, raising concerns for manager Hansi Flick. The match also saw a flurry of yellow cards, with bookings for Jules Kounde, Lamine Yamal, and Fermín Lopez, reflecting the intensity of the contest.

Post-match reactions were mixed. Ferran Torres expressed frustration at the team’s defensive lapses, while Frenkie de Jong admitted, “If you let in three goals, it’s difficult to win.” Flick, however, defended his tactical approach, emphasizing the team’s attacking philosophy.

With this result, Barcelona sits 11th in the group standings with seven points from four matches, while Club Brugge remains in contention with four points. The draw leaves both teams with everything to play for in the remaining fixtures.

This six-goal thriller not only entertained fans but also served as a wake-up call for Barcelona, who must shore up their defense if they hope to progress deep into the tournament.
